net.floodlightcontroller.core.internal

Class OFSwitchManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.floodlightcontroller.core.internal.OFSwitchManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IHAListener, IListener<HAListenerTypeMarker>, INewOFConnectionListener, IOFSwitchManager, IOFSwitchService, IFloodlightModule, IFloodlightService, IStoreListener<org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.DatapathId>

    public class OFSwitchManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements IOFSwitchManager, INewOFConnectionListener, IHAListener, IFloodlightModule, IOFSwitchService, IStoreListener<org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.DatapathId>
    The Switch Manager class contains most of the code involved with dealing with switches. The Switch manager keeps track of the switches known to the controller, their status, and any important information about the switch lifecycle. The Switch Manager also provides the switch service, which allows other modules to hook in switch listeners and get basic access to switch information.
    Author:
    gregor, capveg, sovietaced, rizard

      • transitionToStandby

        public void transitionToStandby()
        Description copied from interface: IHAListener
        This notification is fired if the controller's initial role was ACTIVE and the controller is now transitioning to STANDBY. NOTE: The floodlight platform currently terminates after the transition to STANDBY. Clients should prepare for the shutdown in transitionToStandby (e.g., ensure that current updates to operational states are fully synced).
        Specified by:
        transitionToStandby in interface IHAListener

      • getAllSwitchDpids

        public java.util.Set<org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.DatapathId> getAllSwitchDpids()
        Description copied from interface: IOFSwitchService
        Returns a snapshot of the set DPIDs for all known switches. The returned set is owned by the caller: the caller can modify it at will and changes to the known switches are not reflected in the returned set. The caller needs to call getAllSwitchDpids() if an updated version is needed. See #getSwitch(long) for what "known" switch is.
        Specified by:
        getAllSwitchDpids in interface IOFSwitchService
        Returns:
        the set of DPIDs of all known switches

      • getAllSwitchDpids

        public java.util.Set<org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.DatapathId> getAllSwitchDpids(boolean showInvisible)

      • getSwitch

        public IOFSwitch getSwitch(org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.DatapathId dpid)
        Description copied from interface: IOFSwitchService
        If the switch with the given DPID is known to any controller in the cluster, this method returns the associated IOFSwitch instance. As such the returned switches not necessarily connected or in master role for the local controller. Multiple calls to this method with the same DPID may return different IOFSwitch references. A caller must not store or otherwise rely on IOFSwitch references to be constant over the lifecycle of a switch.
        Specified by:
        getSwitch in interface IOFSwitchService
        Parameters:
        dpid - the dpid of the switch to query
        Returns:
        the IOFSwitch instance associated with the dpid, null if no switch with the dpid is known to the cluster

      • getActiveSwitch

        public IOFSwitch getActiveSwitch(org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.DatapathId dpid)
        Description copied from interface: IOFSwitchService
        If the switch with the given DPID is known to any controller in the cluster, this method returns the associated IOFSwitch instance. As such the returned switches not necessarily connected or in master role for the local controller. Multiple calls to this method with the same DPID may return different IOFSwitch references. A caller must not store or otherwise rely on IOFSwitch references to be constant over the lifecycle of a switch.
        Specified by:
        getActiveSwitch in interface IOFSwitchService
        Parameters:
        dpid - the dpid of the switch to query
        Returns:
        the IOFSwitch instance associated with the dpid, null if no switch with the dpid is known to the cluster OR if the switch status is not considered visible.

      • isCallbackOrderingPrereq

        public boolean isCallbackOrderingPrereq(HAListenerTypeMarker type,
                                        java.lang.String name)
        Description copied from interface: IListener
        Check if the module called name is a callback ordering prerequisite for this module. In other words, if this function returns true for the given name, then this listener will be called after that message listener.
        Specified by:
        isCallbackOrderingPrereq in interface IListener<HAListenerTypeMarker>
        Parameters:
        type - the object type to which this applies
        name - the name of the module
        Returns:
        whether name is a prerequisite.
